result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Robbins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery AMENDED FROM Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct AMENDED FROM 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any addictive substances of any kind, even with a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski in court.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Rebecca Sommers.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Matter was set for Motion to Admit Statements.
Parties request adjournment due to ADA Sommers being in trial.
BTC:  Defendant's appearance is excused today.  Matter will be heard prior to trial on 2/17.

Defendant Jeremy J Robbins in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Trial remains.
Defense req bond mod.
BTC:  Bond mod denied at this time.  Court will consider a bond motion once def is actively pursuing treatment.
Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Restitution request - provided by Victim Witness. VI- N.C.   No amount given - victim information only.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $8,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   No contact with the victim NAC (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Pre-trial conference on May 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jeremy J Robbins in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense and State have a bond stipulation. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond is modified to a $ 2000.00 cash bond, $8000.00 signature bond. All other conditions remain  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy J Robbins in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Jeremy J Robbins in custody.  Eric P. Guttenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
DEF: moves to dismiss CT 1 
BTC: motion to dismiss denied  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
